details.content: 2:11 AM: ISRO says communication with Lander lost, data being analysed
2:19 AM: PM Modi to ISRO scientists: Hope for the best, our country is proud of you
2:32 AM: ISRO Chief K Sivan briefing PM Modi on the status of landing of Vikram
2:45 AM: Communication lost with Vikram at 2.1 km from the lunar surface
3.10 AM: Ups and downs are part of life, says PM Modi while consoling ISRO scientists
3.45 AM: Deviprasad Karnik, scientist ISRO, on being asked if Vikram Lander has crashed: Data is being analysed. We don't have any result yet. It takes time. We are not sure.

details.title: Billion dreams eclipsed as Chandrayaan-2 lander loses signal during final descent
details.content: India’s Chandrayaan-2 lander lost signal with the mission control when it was 2.1 km away from touchdown. The gloom at the mission centre in Bengaluru spoke volumes indicating failure. “The lander’s controls were normal till 2.1 km from lunar surface. We are analysing the data,” said ISRO chief K Sivan. (READ MORE)

details.title: Did Vikram lose control and crash land on the moon?
details.content: Announcing the snapping of communication links, Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman K. Sivan said that the performance of the lander was as per the plan till it was 2.1 km from the moon surface. (READ MORE)

details.title: PM Narendra Modi arrives at ISRO Control Centre
details.content: PM Narendra Modi arrives at ISRO Control Centre to address the nation regarding 'Vikram' lander of Chandrayaan 2.

#WATCH live from Karnataka: Prime Minister Narendra Modi interacts with scientists at ISRO Centre in Bengaluru. #Chandrayaan2 https://t.co/LNyql5GNGd

— ANI (@ANI) September 7, 2019
You are the people who strive for the nation: PM Modi to ISRO scientists
I know you people did not sleep for many nights, but stil I wanted to speak to you peple: PM Modi to ISO scientists
ISRO lives and works for India and I lived every moment with you, says PM Modi
This is not a set back, out resolve has strengthened: PM Modi
For the last few hours entire nation was awake beacause of our scientists: PM Modi
We are proud of our space programme and our scientist because of their hardwork: PM Modi
People have got greater quality of life thanks to our scientists, says PM Modi
The best is yet to come: PM Modi

PM Narendra Modi addressing ISRO scientists: Friends I could feel what you were going through few hours back, your eyes were conveying a lot. You live for India's honour, I salute you. #Chandrayaan2 pic.twitter.com/cF63Mv8fqY

— ANI (@ANI) September 7, 2019
India is with you: PM Modi to scientists

PM Narendra Modi: For last few hours the entire nation was worried. Everyone stands in solidarity with our scientists. We are proud of our space program. Today our resolve to touch the moon has grown even stronger
You will give us several more opportunities to smile: PM Modi

PM Narendra Modi: We will rise to the occasion and reach even newer heights of success. To our scientists I want to say- India is with you. You are exceptional professionals who have made an incredible contribution to national progress. #Chandrayaan2 pic.twitter.com/U9TlYOJceQ

— ANI (@ANI) September 7, 2019
We will bounce back again: PM Modi
The effort was worth it and so was the journey: PM Modi
The learning today will make us strong and greater: PM Modi
There will be a brighter new dawn and a better tomorrow, says PM Modi

Nothing to say... just feels proud. #ISRO pic.twitter.com/iDxRqvhHgD

— Pema Khandu (@PemaKhanduBJP) September 6, 2019

We are with you @isro. Proud of you to have dared to land at south pole of the moon where no one else has ever attempted. Your capabilities and achievements have always made our country stand tall. This is just a success postponed. #Chandrayaan2

— B.S. Yediyurappa (@BSYBJP) September 7, 2019
Science has no failure it has only exercise: PM Modi

details.title: Learning from today will make us stronger and better: PM Modi
details.content: PM Narendra Modi: Today I can proudly say that the effort was worth it & so was the journey. Our team worked hard, traveled far & these very teachings will remain with us. The learning from today will make us stronger and better.
We will not stop until we reach the target: PM Modi
ISRO chairman K Sivan shares an emotional moment with PM Modi after the PM's moving speech to scientists.

details.title: PM Narendra Modi hugged and consoled ISRO Chief K Sivan
details.content:
#WATCH PM Narendra Modi hugged and consoled ISRO Chief K Sivan after he(Sivan) broke down. #Chandrayaan2 pic.twitter.com/bytNChtqNK

— ANI (@ANI) September 7, 2019
